alert.note: Alert for Ascension; Assumption; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 11:16AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. John The Baptist, east central Ascension, eastern St. James, St. Charles, northwestern Lafourche, northwestern Jefferson and east central Assumption Parishes through NOON CST... At 1115 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Whitehall to Thibodaux. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Thibodaux, Reserve, Hahnville, Laplace, Metairie, Avondale, Jefferson, Harahan, Gramercy, Lutcher, Montz, Luling, Garyville, River Ridge, Boutte, Raceland, Ama, Chackbay, Destrehan and St. Rose. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 193 and 227. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Ascension; Assumption; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
